comments.body: Is there some example code that we can build and test here? Since we don't have `make check`, this will be very helpful.

There is a folder `examples` and these are also compiled with `make all`.

in the readme I read:

```
  if you are using the parallel version of MUMPS, or

    "./ssimpletest < input_simpletest_real"
    "./dsimpletest < input_simpletest_real"
    "./csimpletest < input_simpletest_cmplx"
    "./zsimpletest < input_simpletest_cmplx"
```

Should I run these in the `build.sh`?

If I do this I get this error:

```
./ssimpletest
dyld: Library not loaded: @rpath/libopenblasp-r0.2.18.dylib
  Referenced from: /Users/basnijholt/anaconda3/conda-bld/mumps_1476728522822/work/MUMPS_5.0.1/examples/./ssimpletest
  Reason: image not found
/Users/basnijholt/anaconda3/conda-bld/mumps_1476728522822/work/MUMPS_5.0.1/conda_build.sh: line 16:  5672 Abort trap: 6           ./ssimpletest < input_simpletest_real
Command failed: /bin/bash -x -e /Users/basnijholt/anaconda3/conda-bld/mumps_1476728522822/work/MUMPS_5.0.1/conda_build.sh
```

You seem to know this issue: https://github.com/conda-forge/numpy-feedstock/issues/26

Know what to do?
The changes to the RPATH above should fix it.
Yes, running the examples you found above sound like a good plan.
